com.vk.sdk

Class VKSdk

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vk.sdk.VKSdk

  • public class VKSdk
extends java.lang.Object
    Entry point of SDK. See example for using properly

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int VK_SDK_REQUEST_CODE
      Start SDK activity for result with that request code

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        public static VKSdk instance()
        Returns instance of VK sdk. You should never use that directly

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(VKSdkListener listener,
              java.lang.String appId)
        Initialize SDK with responder for global SDK events
        Parameters:
        listener - responder for global SDK events
        appId - your application id (if you haven't, you can create standalone application here https://vk.com/editapp?act=create )

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(VKSdkListener listener,
              java.lang.String appId,
              VKAccessToken token)
        Initialize SDK with responder for global SDK events and custom token key (e.g., saved from other source or for some test reasons)
        Parameters:
        listener - responder for global SDK events
        appId - your application id (if you haven't, you can create standalone application here https://vk.com/editapp?act=create )
        token - custom-created access token

      • authorize

        public static void authorize(java.lang.String... scope)
        Starts authorization process. If VKapp is available in system, it will opens and requests access from user. Otherwise UIWebView with standard UINavigationBar will be opened for access request.
        Parameters:
        scope - array of permissions for your applications. All permissions you can

      • authorize

        public static void authorize(java.lang.String[] scope,
             boolean revoke,
             boolean forceOAuth)
        Starts authorization process. If VKapp is available in system, it will opens and requests access from user. Otherwise UIWebView with standard UINavigationBar will be opened for access request.
        Parameters:
        scope - array of permissions for your applications. All permissions you can
        revoke - if true, user will allow logout (to change user)
        forceOAuth - sdk will use only oauth authorization, through uiwebview

      • sdkListener

        public VKSdkListener sdkListener()
        Returns current VK SDK listener
        Returns:
        Current sdk listener

      • setSdkListener

        public void setSdkListener(VKSdkListener newListener)
        Sets current VK SDK listener
        Parameters:
        newListener - listener for SDK

      • processActivityResult

        public static boolean processActivityResult(int resultCode,
                            Intent result)
        Pass data of onActivityResult() function here
        Parameters:
        resultCode - result code of activity result
        result - intent passed by activity
        Returns:
        If SDK parsed activity result properly, returns true. You can return from onActivityResult(). Otherwise, returns false.

      • setAccessToken

        public static void setAccessToken(VKAccessToken token)
        Set API token to passed
        Parameters:
        token - token must be used for API requests

      • getAccessToken

        public static VKAccessToken getAccessToken()
        Returns token for API requests
        Returns:
        Received access token or null, if user not yet authorized

      • setAccessTokenError

        public static void setAccessTokenError(VKError error)
        Notify SDK that user denied login
        Parameters:
        error - description of error while authorizing user
